item.title: R and Python
item.description: Coding with R and Python One thing that is cool about R is that you can easily transfer codes/objects from R to Python and vice versa. Below is an example of how you can do this. First, load the ‘reticulate’ package in R and define your object (which could be anything really). In this case, I will be defining “This is my” as the object “dog”. #R code chunk library(reticulate) dog<-"This is my" Now, define “dog” (or the assigned name you used above) as an object in Python.
